meanings.definition: Continue in a course of action even in the face of difficulty or with little or no prospect of success.
meanings.sent1: She perseverated in her studies despite finding the subject challenging.
meanings.sent2: He always perseverated in his goal to learn a new language.
meanings.sent3: The little ant perseverated in carrying the heavy leaf to its anthill.
meanings.sent4: The determined athlete perseverated through the tough training sessions.
meanings.sent5: The seed perseverated in growing, pushing through the hard soil to reach the sunlight.

meanings.definition: Repeat or prolong an action, thought, or utterance after the stimulus that prompted it has ceased.
meanings.sent1: The child perseverated on the same question, asking it repeatedly.
meanings.sent2: After the song ended, the melody perseverated in his mind.
meanings.sent3: The broken record player perseverated on the same note, creating a funny sound.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter perseverated in the room long after the joke was told.
meanings.sent5: The memory of the event perseverated in his thoughts, replaying over and over.
